name: Narrative Agent Evaluation Set
description: Test cases for the Narrative Agent, focusing on synthesis, Markdown formatting, and visualization integration.

parts.text:
# Analysis of Average Score

> The average score is 550.5.

## Key Findings

Based on the data provided, here are the main findings:
* The **average (mean) score** calculated is **550.5**.
* The median score is 540.0.
* The standard deviation of scores is 75.2.

## Conclusion

The primary finding is that the average score is **550.5**. This provides a central tendency for the dataset analyzed.

{"original_question": "How do scores compare across regions?", "analysis_results": {"results": [{"analysis_type": "aggregation", "group_by_columns": ["region"], "metric_column": "score", "groups": [{"region": "North", "mean_score": 520.0}, {"region": "South", "mean_score": 580.0}]}], "suggestions": []}, "visualizations": [{"chart_spec": {"$schema": "https://vega.github.io/schema/vega-lite/v5.json", "title": "Average Scores by Region", "data": {"values": [{"region": "North", "mean_score": 520.0}, {"region": "South", "mean_score": 580.0}]}, "mark": "bar", "encoding": {"x": {"field": "region", "type": "nominal"}, "y": {"field": "mean_score", "type": "quantitative"}}}, "filterable_columns": ["region"]}]}

{"original_question": "What are the key stats for different subjects?", "analysis_results": {"results": [{"analysis_type": "descriptive_statistics", "column": "Math", "metrics": {"mean": 600, "median": 605, "std_dev": 50}}, {"analysis_type": "descriptive_statistics", "column": "Science", "metrics": {"mean": 620, "median": 625, "std_dev": 45}}], "suggestions": []}, "visualizations": []}

# Key Statistics for Different Subjects

> Science has a slightly higher average score and lower variability compared to Math.

## Key Findings

The following table summarizes the key descriptive statistics for Math and Science scores:

| Subject | Mean Score | Median Score | Standard Deviation |
|---|---|---|---|
| Math | **600** | 605 | 50 |
| Science | **620** | 625 | 45 |

## Conclusion

Overall, students performed slightly better in Science (average score **620**) compared to Math (average score **600**). Science scores also appear to be slightly less spread out (standard deviation of 45) than Math scores (standard deviation of 50).
